p: Methods: This prospective observational study was conducted at Nakhonpathom hospital, a 670-bed tertiary care hospital in Thailand during December 2014 and August 2015. Inclusion criteria were age [>=] 18 years, fever, at least 1 symptom of UTI (dysuria, frequent or urgent urination, flank pain or costovertebral tenderness) and pyuria (defined by a presence of [>=] 5 WBC per high power field in a centrifuged sediment). Patients were excluded if they: (1) had healthcare associated infection; (2) had taken antibiotics during 72 h prior to hospitalization; (3) presented with severe sepsis/septic shock. Clinical factors associated with bacteremia were determined.
